page.title: 08FRANKLEY - A LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Frankley as an area has grown greatly in the last ten years.Since the middle of the seventies it has been an over spill area for the overcrowded city of Birmingham.In this time many families have moved to the new estate which spreads south from the old country part of Frankley.The new part seems to be the mid-point between the urban area of the West Midlands and the countryside of Hereford/Worcester.The housing is mainly semi-detached or terraced brickbuilt houses with some blocks of low flats.These contrasts with the older detached houses in the area.Also purpose built for the estate are two First,two Middle and one High School.The latter is a community school and its sports hall,theatre and library are used by the public and have increased the area's facilities.
